result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael Sorsek was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: CONSECUTIVE to any sentence with credit for 29 (TWENTY-NINE) days served; Huber privileges.  Court recommends against electronic monitoring.

miscConds.notes: Defendant to pay all applicable costs and surcharges, and supervision fees or CIVIL JUDGMENT will be entered. Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs. Court orders defendant to pay all costs, fees and surcharges by 10-20-2016 or a civil judgment to be entered with tax intercept.  Bail on deposit to be applied if applicable.

No firearms, no weapons.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor.  Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.
Court does not suspend driving privileges.
Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment. Maintain absolute sobriety. No drugs. No alcohol. Random urine screens and breathalyzer test.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Michael Sorsek

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Filed, sdg.
records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: (2).  On behalf of Defendant.  Filed, sdg.

Defendant Michael Sorsek in court with attorney Calvin R. Malone.  Defendant Michael Sorsek in custody.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements made as to sentencing.  Additional statements by:  Diane Schacht.

Court sentenced defendant to serve 6 (SIX) MONTHS in the House of Correction CONSECUTIVE to any sentence with credit for 29 (TWENTY-NINE) days served; Huber privileges.  Court recommends against electronic monitoring.  COURT STAYED THE SENTENCE and placed the defendant on probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 18 MONTHS.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
* Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment
   and successfully complete recommended treatment.
* Maintain absolute sobriety.  No drugs.  No alcohol. 
* Random urine screens and breathalyzer test.
* No firearms, no weapons.
* Obtain and maintain employment.
* Defendant to pay all applicable costs and surcharges,
   and supervision fees or CIVIL JUDGMENT will be entered.

Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs.  Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor.  Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.  

Court orders defendant to pay all costs, fees and surcharges by 10-20-2016 or a civil judgment to be entered with tax intercept.  Bail on deposit to be applied if applicable.

Court does not suspend driving privileges.

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor. Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored. Court advised defendant of his right to seek postconviction relief.  Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs.

Filed,
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement;
Pretrial Incarceration Credit Form.

Bail motion by defense argued and denied by the Court.

Defendant is REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department pending Sentencing.

Defendant Michael Sorsek in court with attorney Jamie Cimpl-Wiemer for Calvin R. Malone.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin. sdg
  The defendant is not in compliance with the terms of the Deferred Prosecution Agreement.  Based upon the defendant's non-compliance, the court revoked the Deferred Prosecution Agreement; proceedings reinstated.  Court orders entry of judgment of conviction.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 20, 2015 at 10:00 am.
Per email from the Public Defender, matter set for 10-06-2015 at 3:00p for Review. sdg
Court order the defendant relieved of Justice Point monitoring.  lms
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE JUDGE ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT.

Attorney Calvin R. Malone in court.  Brad A. Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy court clerk: LMS.  Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued.  NO BAIL IS FORFEITED.
Deferred Prosecution Agreement Progress report, received and filed. lms

Defendant Michael Sorsek in court with attorney Calvin R. Malone.  Brad A. Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy court clerk: LMS.

Defendant had Wiser Choice assessment and has begun a higher level treatment.  Review hearing scheduled for January 13, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Deferred Prosecution Agreement Progress report, received and filed. lms
Deferred Prosecution Agreement Non-Compliance report from JusticePoint, received and filed. lms

Defendant Michael Sorsek in court with attorney Calvin R. Malone.  Brad A. Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy court clerk: LMS.

Defendant is not maintaining sobriety.  Defendant needs to enroll in in patient treatment.  Defendant to be screen within the next week.  Review hearing scheduled for December 16, 2014 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.  lms

Defendant Michael Sorsek in court with attorney Calvin R. Malone.  Brad A. Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy court clerk: LMS.  Defendant has reported to JusticePoint.  Defendant has previously tested positive and has not be randomly tested since last court date.  Defendant is employed and needs to complete community service.  Review hearing scheduled for November 17, 2014 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.  lms

Defendant Michael Sorsek in court with attorney Calvin R. Malone.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy court clerk: LMS.  Defendant needs to pay assessment fee and begin community service.  Review hearing scheduled for October 20, 2014 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.lms

Defendant Michael Sorsek in court with attorney Cynthia Wynn for attorney Calvin R. Malone.  Brad A. Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy court clerk: LMS.

Court vacates the warrant.    Court ordered case adjourned for review hearing in Branch 6.  Review hearing scheduled for September 30, 2014 at 08:30 am.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE JUDGE ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT.

Defendant Michael Sorsek not in court.  Brad A. Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk: LMS.  NO FILE IN COURT.  Case was staffed with all parties.  Defendant is not in compliance with the agreement.   State is requesting a warrant be issued.  Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued.  NO BAIL IS FORFEITED.  Court vacated future court dates.

Defendant Michael Sorsek in court with attorney Caitlin Firer for attorney Calvin R. Malone.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk: LMS.   Defendant is testing positive. Defense feels case needs to be staffed with all parties to develope a treatment plan.  State is requesting a short review date.  Review hearing scheduled for September 30, 2014 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.  lms

Defendant Michael Sorsek in court.  Brad A. Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk: LMS.  OFF THE RECORD.  Defendant counsel ill.    Court ordered case adjourned for review hearing in Branch 6.  Review hearing scheduled for September 8, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.  lms

Defendant Michael Sorsek in court with attorney Alejandro A Lockwood (for attorney Malone).  Paul M Hauer appeared for the State of Wisconsin (for ADA Chojnacki).    Filed, signed Deferred Prosecution Agreement.  The court reviewed the Agreement with the defendant.  
The defendant was advised of his/her constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum to Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights received and filed.  The parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  The Court found the defendant guilty but WITHHELD entry.
The court approved the Deferred Prosecution Agreement and found it to be in the best interest of the parties and the general public.
Case adjourned to for review hearing in Branch 6.  Review hearing scheduled for August 26, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Michael Sorsek in court with attorney Calvin R Malone.  Danielle E Chojnacki appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant missed his TAD assessment. Defense requesting an adjournment. Court adjourned case for a Deferred Prosecution Agreement Hearing in Branch 26.  Deferred prosecution agreement hearing scheduled for July 1, 2014 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Michael Sorsek in court with attorney Calvin R Malone.  Danielle E Chojnacki appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Deputy Court Clerk: alp   Case is being considered for a DPA.  Deferred prosecution agreement hearing scheduled for 06-11-2014 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Michael Sorsek in court with attorney Calvin R Malone.  Danielle E Chojnacki appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deferred prosecution agreement hearing scheduled for May 22, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Michael Sorsek in court with attorney Calvin R. Malone.  Paul M. Hauer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: alp  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 16, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.   Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pleads not guilty.

Defendant Michael Sorsek in court with attorney Calvin R. Malone.  Danielle Chojnacki for William Levins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  Court consented to substitution against Judge Konkol.  Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge Pocan, Br. 26.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 14, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Filed, Justice Point Pretrial Report dated 3/3/14.
css

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY  to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.  No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Michael Sorsek in court with attorney Calvin R Malone.  Defendant Michael Sorsek in custody.  Carole R Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Konkol, Branch 44. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 5, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
Arrest Warrant received from the D.A.'s office on filing date of Criminal Complaint.
